meanings.sent1: The sulcated surface of the pumpkin made it easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The sulcated road helped drain rainwater efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The sulcated pattern on the tree bark looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her sulcated fingerprints left a unique mark at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The sulcated design on the pottery added a beautiful texture.

meanings.sent1: The sulcated tire tread provided excellent traction on the wet road.

meanings.sent3: The sulcated pattern on the fabric resembled tiny waves.

meanings.definition: To make grooves or furrows in.
meanings.sent1: She carefully sulcated the clay to create a decorative border.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sulcated the field to improve water drainage.
meanings.sent3: The artist sulcated the metal to add texture to the sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter sulcated the wood for a more secure joint.
meanings.sent5: He sulcated the leather to give it a unique, handcrafted look.
